subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Umayyad Dynasty: Islam Becomes an Empire
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Umayyad Dynasty: Islam Becomes an Empire.

hook.text: The caliphate became a dynasty. Power shifted from piety to politics. Islam went from movement to empire overnight.

buildup.text: The Umayyads ruled from Damascus (661-750). They built the Dome of the Rock and expanded Islam from Spain to India.

discovery.text: Arabic became the empire's official language. Coins, roads, and postal systems unified a massive territory.

twist.text: Critics said the Umayyads were more Arab than Muslim. Non-Arab converts were treated as second-class citizens.

climax.text: The Abbasid revolution overthrew them in 750. But Islam's imperial model was set: faith and statecraft, intertwined.

punchline.text: The Umayyads built an empire. Their fall proved Islam outlives any dynasty.

quiz.question: What did the Umayyad Dynasty accomplish?
options: Built an empire from Spain to India with Arabic as its language
